data.title: Westminster Public Schools
data.text:
The first day of school is Tuesday, August 13th!

Learn More about Get Ready for First Day of School!

With their former principal cheering them on, 110 Hidden Lake Secondary School graduates walked across the stage at the Ellie Caulkins Opera House to begin the next chapter of their lives.

Learn More about HIDDEN LAKE GRADUATES HONOR STUDENTS AND FORMER PRINCIPAL

The stunning view of the Rocky Mountains met Westminster High School students and their families as they celebrated graduation at the Colorado Convention Center.

Learn More about WESTY GRADS STEP INTO THE FUTURE

No better way to end the school year with popsicles and time outside.

Learn More about FIELD DAY FUN!

A tradition like no other at Westminster High School was extra special this year.

Learn More about THE CLASS OF 2024 MOVES UP

WHS Senior Makayla Galler has her sights set on the moon, Mars, and beyond!

Learn More about SPACE AWAITS!

This evening, employees who announced their retirement will be celebrated at the WHS Cafe.

Learn More about WPS RETIREES TO BE CELEBRATED

Superintendent Swanson speaks about her optimism for WPS in this week's note.

Learn More about A NOTE FROM SUPERINTENDENT SWANSON | MAY 15

This year's LatinaCon saw over 180 high school and middle school students and parents attend a day of learning sessions and special guest speakers.

Learn More about WPS’ 2024 SPRING LATINACON A HUGE HIT!

This spring, the Human Resources Department held the first of many meetings with current WPS Educational Support Professionals (ESP) to encourage them to go back to school and get their teaching license.

Learn More about WPS' ANSWER TO TEACHER SHORTAGE IS TO ‘GROW OUR OWN’

Sandoval has joined the Human Resources team as the new Director of Wellness.

Learn More about WPS PROVIDING ADDITIONAL MENTAL HEALTH SUPPORT FOR EMPLOYEES

Superintendent Swanson speaks on all teachers and students who received great awards this month.

Learn More about A NOTE FROM SUPERINTENDENT SWANSON | MAY 1

The Westminster Public Schools Drone Soccer team took home the silver medal in the first ever Academic Drone Soccer World Cup in San Diego last month

Learn More about WPS DRONE SOCCER TEAM SCORES BIG IN SAN DIEGO

Close to 100 awards were handed out to students in a range of categories from CTE exhibit, visual arts and performing arts.

Learn More about WPS CELEBRATES EXCELLENCE

Maureen Barela-Wille, Anne Farrell and Nicole Hurd have been named 2024 Westminster Elks Teachers of the year.

Learn More about 2024 TEACHERS OF THE YEAR HONORED

She is a wizard in accounting and has deep roots in Westminster Public Schools.

Learn More about STAFF SPOTLIGHT: PENNY RODRIGUEZ

In her final meeting with the Superintendent Support Cabinet and the Teacher Leadership Cabinet, Dr. Swanson reflects on the conversations over the years.

Learn More about A NOTE FROM SUPERINTENDENT SWANSON | APRIL 17

Students from across the district will showcase their art over the next week before the kick off of the Westminster Arts Week.

Learn More about WESTMINSTER PUBLIC SCHOOLS PARTNERS WITH THE CITY OF WESTMINSTER FOR ARTS WEEK

The wide range of talents and skills of Westminster Public Schools students will be on full display during the CE! awards and talent show on Wednesday, April 24.

Learn More about CELEBRATING EXCELLENCE! TALENT AND AWARDS SHOW NEXT WEEK
